intro: Polycarpaea corymbosa var. breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats.
